hero.title: Hare Krishna!
hero.subtitle: Welcome to ISKCON Kurnool ‚Äì Sri Sri Jagannath Mandir
hero.description: A spiritual sanctuary dedicated to the teachings of His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, spreading Krishna consciousness through kirtan, philosophy and service.
explore.title: Explore ISKCON Kurnool
explore.card1.title: Darshan & Timings
explore.card1.text: Experience the daily darshan, arati schedule, and Sunday feast timings at our sacred temple.
explore.card2.title: Programs & Classes
explore.card2.text: Join Bhagavad-gita classes, youth programs, nama-hatta and festival celebrations year-round.
explore.card3.title: Seva & Donations
explore.card3.text: Participate in deity seva, prasadam distribution and temple maintenance through your support.
aboutPreview.title: About ISKCON Kurnool
aboutPreview.text1: ISKCON Kurnool is a vibrant center of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, dedicated to spreading the chanting of the holy names and the teachings of Bhagavad-gita and Srimad-Bhagavatam in the spiritual city of Kurnool.
aboutPreview.text2: Our temple conducts regular programs, festivals and outreach activities for devotees, students, families and spiritual seekers. Whether you are beginning your spiritual journey or are an experienced practitioner, there is a place for you at ISKCON Kurnool.
whyVisit.title: Why Visit ISKCON Kurnool?
whyVisit.card1.title: Spiritual Growth
whyVisit.card1.text: Experience personal spiritual development through deity worship and philosophical teachings.
whyVisit.card2.title: Prasadam
whyVisit.card2.text: Enjoy delicious vegetarian food sanctified through offerings to Krishna.
whyVisit.card3.title: Community
whyVisit.card3.text: Connect with a warm community of devotees across all age groups and backgrounds.
whyVisit.card4.title: Kirtan & Music
whyVisit.card4.text: Participate in uplifting kirtans and devotional music that touches the soul.
sunday.title: Join us this Sunday
sunday.text: Experience the Sunday Feast ‚Äì an evening of kirtan, pravachan, arati and sumptuous Krishna prasadam in the association of devotees. All are welcome!
updates.title: Latest Updates
updates.card1.title: Upcoming Festivals
updates.card1.text: Stay tuned for Vasanta Panchami and other spiritual celebrations coming soon at the temple.
updates.card2.title: Youth Satsang
updates.card2.text: College and school students gather for inspiring discussions, kirtan and prasadam every Saturday.
updates.card3.title: Morning Arati
updates.card3.text: Start your day with the early morning mangala arati at 5:00 AM. All devotees welcome!
cta.title: Ready to Experience Krishna Consciousness?
cta.text: Visit our temple, join our programs, or connect with us through any means. We are here to serve you on your spiritual journey.
about.pageSubtitle: Understanding Our Mission, Values & Spiritual Heritage
about.text1: The International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON), also known as the Hare Krishna movement, was founded in 1966 by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. The society is dedicated to spreading the chanting of the holy names of Krishna and the teachings of Bhagavad-gita and Srimad-Bhagavatam as a means for spiritual enlightenment and material liberation.
about.text2: ISKCON operates over 500 temples, schools and restaurants worldwide, and continues to distribute literature to millions of people seeking spiritual knowledge and a higher purpose in life.
about.bhaktiYogaDesc: Devotional service as the path to enlightenment
about.vegetarianDesc: Non-violence and compassion towards all living beings
about.chantingDesc: Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare...
about.missionText: ISKCON Kurnool serves as a spiritual home for devotees, students and families in and around Kurnool, providing daily deity worship, kirtan, discourses and prasadam distribution. We are committed to:
about.mission4: Serving all with love and devotion
about.offerText: The temple regularly conducts programs, festivals and outreach activities following the standards and teachings of Srila Prabhupada and the wider ISKCON society:
about.prabhuppadaBio: His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada (1896-1977) is the Founder-Acharya of ISKCON, whose revolutionary books and teachings guide all activities of ISKCON centers worldwide, including ISKCON Kurnool. He dedicated his life to spreading Krishna consciousness to every corner of the world.
about.prabhupadaLegacy: Srila Prabhupada's legacy continues through the dedicated service of thousands of devotees who strive to fulfill his mission of making Krishna consciousness available to all people regardless of their background or status.
about.value1Desc: Pure devotional service to the Lord and all His creation.
about.value2Desc: Building a supportive sangha (community) of sincere seekers.
about.value3Desc: Sharing authentic Vedic wisdom and spiritual education.
about.value4Desc: Selfless service to all without expectation of reward.
about.ctaText: Whether you are new to Krishna consciousness or are an experienced practitioner, there is a place for you at ISKCON Kurnool.
footer.title: ISKCON Kurnool
footer.subtitle: Sri Sri Jagannath Mandir
footer.copyright: ¬© 2026 ISKCON Kurnool ‚Äì International Society for Krishna Consciousness
footer.dedication: Dedicated to the teachings of His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada
deities.subtitle: The worship of the Deities is the heart of ISKCON temples, performed according to the standards given by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada.
deities.jagannath.title: Sri Sri Jagannath Baladeva Subhadra
deities.jagannath.text: The merciful Lord of the universe, Sri Jagannath, along with His brother Baladeva and sister Subhadra, bestows their blessings upon the devotees of Kurnool through Their beautiful darshan.
deities.gauraNitai.title: Sri Sri Gaura Nitai
deities.gauraNitai.text: Lord Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and Lord Nityananda are the most compassionate incarnation of the Lord, freely distributing the chanting of the holy names in this age of Kali.
deities.darshan.title: Darshan & Altar
deities.darshan.text: Devotees can have darshan of the Deities during the temple's regular darshan hours and arati timings, accompanied by kirtan and devotional atmosphere. Please refer to the Visit page for detailed timings.
deities.gallery.title: Deity Darshan Glimpses
deities.gallery.text: For more photos and daily darshan updates, please visit our social media pages linked in the footer.
visit.subtitle: Darshan Timings, Location & Visitor Information
visit.addressFull: Bhageerathi Complex, 2nd Floor, Park Road, Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh, India
visit.timingsNote: Please confirm exact timings with temple. Timings may vary on festivals.
visit.sundayFeast.title: Sunday Feast Program
visit.sundayFeast.description: Every Sunday, ISKCON Kurnool conducts a special evening program featuring kirtan, discourse on Bhagavad-gita or Srimad-Bhagavatam, and delicious Krishna-prasadam. All are welcome!
visit.guidelines.title: Visitor Guidelines
visit.dos.title: Do's
visit.dos.item3: Maintain silence in the temple hall
visit.donts.title: Don'ts
visit.donts.item3: No mobile phones in loud mode
visit.donts.item5: Do not point feet towards deities
visit.info.title: Important Information
visit.info.dressCodeText: Wear clean, modest clothing. Women should prefer sarees or long dresses. Men should wear dhotis or long pants.
visit.info.photographyText: Photography may be restricted during certain aratis. Always ask temple authorities before taking photos.
visit.info.firstVisitText: Newcomers are always welcome! Approach any devotee for guidance on darshan etiquette.
visit.info.prasadamText: Accept prasadam with your right hand and eat with gratitude. Do not waste or disrespect food.
visit.cta.title: Plan Your Visit Today
visit.cta.text: Experience the spiritual atmosphere and divine darshan at ISKCON Kurnool.
programs.subtitle: Connect with Krishna through Classes, Kirtan & Community Service
programs.sundayFeast.title: Sunday Feast Program
programs.sundayFeast.description: The Sunday Feast is a weekly festival featuring kirtan, discourse on Bhagavad-gita or Srimad-Bhagavatam, and delicious Krishna-prasadam for all visitors. This is the perfect way to experience the warmth of our spiritual community.
programs.sundayFeast.joinText: Experience Krishna consciousness with our spiritual family every Sunday.
programs.dailyClasses.title: Daily Scriptural Classes
programs.dailyClasses.description: Understand the wisdom of Bhagavad-gita and Srimad-Bhagavatam through regular classes.
programs.bhagavatam.title: Bhagavatam Class
programs.bhagavatam.description: Deep dive into the spiritual teachings of Srimad-Bhagavatam, the most important Vedic scripture.
programs.gita.title: Bhagavad-gita Class
programs.gita.description: Systematic study of the Bhagavad-gita, Lord Krishna's teachings to Arjuna on the battlefield.
programs.youth.title: Youth & Student Programs
programs.youth.description: Special programs designed for young seekers to balance spiritual life with studies.
programs.youthSatsang.title: Youth Satsang
programs.campus.title: Campus & Hostel Programs
programs.campus.point4: ‚Ä¢ Contact us to schedule your college program
programs.family.title: Children & Family Programs
programs.family.description: Bring your family and children to grow together in Krishna consciousness.
programs.children.title: Children's Krishna Club
programs.children.description: Weekly or monthly sessions for kids aged 4-12 featuring:
programs.children.point4: ‚úì Games based on Krishna conscious values
programs.familySatsang.title: Family Satsang
programs.familySatsang.point2: ‚úì Short talks on family values & spirituality
programs.familySatsang.point3: ‚úì Games and activities for all ages
programs.namahatta.title: Nama-hatta & Home Programs
programs.namahatta.description: Nama-hatta (song of the holy names) programs bring Krishna consciousness directly to your home or neighborhood. These intimate gatherings feature kirtan, reading, discussions and prasadam distribution.
programs.namahatta.host.title: Host a Program
programs.namahatta.host.text: Organize kirtan and discourse in your home or locality
programs.namahatta.join.title: Join a Group
programs.namahatta.join.text: Participate in existing Nama-hatta groups in your area
programs.namahatta.contact.title: Contact Temple
programs.namahatta.contact.text: Schedule or coordinate with our office for details
programs.festivals.title: Festival Celebrations
programs.festivals.description: ISKCON Kurnool celebrates major Vedic festivals throughout the year with grand arrangements:
programs.cta.title: Ready to Join a Program?
programs.cta.text: Contact the temple office or visit us on Sunday for the Feast Program. All are welcome regardless of background or experience level.
calendar.subtitle: Complete Year Festival Guide (following ISKCON Festival Calendar 2026)
calendar.noteText: Dates are taken from published ISKCON 2026 festival and Ekadashi lists (Gaurabda 539‚Äì540). For fasting-breaking times (parana) and local adjustments, please confirm with ISKCON Kurnool.
calendar.gauraPurnimaDesc: Most auspicious Vaishnava festival celebrating Lord Chaitanya, who inaugurated the congregational chanting of the holy names. Fasting till moonrise.
calendar.ramaNavamiDesc: Celebrates Lord Rama's divine appearance. Devotees observe fasting till sunset, hear Ramayana pastimes, and join special arati and kirtan.
calendar.aboutText: This calendar presents ISKCON Vaishnava observances for 2026 (festivals, Ekadashis, appearance and disappearance days). It is designed as a reference for devotees in Kurnool and nearby areas.
donate.subtitle: Your Contribution Helps Spread Krishna Consciousness
donate.whySupport.title: Why Support ISKCON Kurnool?
donate.whySupport.text: ISKCON temples maintain daily deity worship, distributes free prasadam, conducts spiritual education, and serve the community. Your generous donations help us continue this sacred service. Even a small offering made with devotion becomes invaluable in Krishna's eyes.
donate.sevaTypes.title: Types of Seva (Service)
donate.annadan.title: Annadan / Prasadam Seva
donate.annadan.description: Support the distribution of sanctified vegetarian food (prasadam) to visitors, devotees and needy people.
donate.deity.title: Deity Worship Seva
donate.deity.description: Contribute towards bhoga (food offerings), flowers, dresses and decorations of Sri Sri Jagannath, Baladeva, Subhadra and Sri Sri Gaura Nitai.
donate.temple.title: Temple & Outreach Seva
donate.temple.description: Help maintain the temple premises, support preaching programs, books distribution and community outreach activities.
donate.howToDonate.title: How to Donate
donate.howToDonate.subtitle: Choose your preferred method to support our temple. Please confirm bank and UPI details directly with the temple office.
donate.bank.title: Bank Transfer
donate.upi.title: UPI & Digital Payment
donate.upi.qr: Contact temple for UPI QR code
donate.upi.gateway: Links available on temple contact page
donate.important.title: Important Information
donate.important.confirmText: directly from ISKCON Kurnool temple office before making any transfer. Do not rely on unverified sources.
donate.important.taxText: If registered for 80G exemption, we can provide receipts for your donation for income tax purposes.
donate.important.receiptText: Please provide your name, address and contact details after donation for temple records and 80G certificate (if applicable).
donate.important.sevaText: Donate with a pure heart and Krishna consciousness, expecting nothing in return. This is the true spirit of seva.
donate.impact.title: Impact of Your Donation
donate.cta.title: Ready to Make a Difference?
donate.cta.text: Contact the temple office for confirmed bank and UPI details, or visit us to donate in person.
contact.subtitle: Get in Touch for Darshan, Programs, Donations & Seva Opportunities
contact.sundayTiming: As per Sunday Feast program timing
contact.formSubtitle: Have a question or want to discuss something? Fill the form below and we'll get back to you soon.
contact.form.messagePlaceholder: Write your query or message here...
contact.socialSubtitle: Follow ISKCON Kurnool for daily darshan updates, festival announcements and spiritual content.
contact.youtube.title: YouTube
contact.instagram.title: Instagram
contact.facebook.title: Facebook
contact.whatsapp.title: WhatsApp
contact.faq1.question: What are the temple timings?
contact.faq1.answer: Daily darshan and arati are available from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM. Please see the Visit page for detailed timings of each arati.
contact.faq2.question: Can I visit the temple for the first time?
contact.faq2.answer: Absolutely! All are welcome regardless of background or experience. Approach any devotee for guidance on temple etiquette and darshan.
contact.faq3.question: Is there a dress code?
contact.faq3.answer: Yes, please wear clean and modest clothing. Women should prefer sarees or long dresses. Men should wear dhotis or long pants. This shows respect to the deity and the spiritual space.
contact.faq4.question: How do I make a donation?
contact.faq4.answer: You can donate through bank transfer, UPI, or in person at the temple. Visit the Donate page for details and confirmed banking information.
contact.faq5.question: Can I organize a group visit or program?
contact.faq5.answer: Yes! Contact the temple office with details about your group size and preferred date/time. We can arrange special programs or group darshan sessions.
contact.faq6.question: What programs are available?
contact.faq6.answer: We conduct daily classes, Sunday Feast, youth programs, family satsangs, and festival celebrations. Check the Programs page for a complete list.
contact.cta.title: Ready to Connect?
contact.cta.text: Reach out via phone, email, or visit us in person. We look forward to welcoming you to our spiritual family.
